conclusion: Analyze changes in state from A to B and B to C using the first law of thermodynamics.
Internal energy change for an ideal gas depends only on temperature.
Formula for internal energy change: ΔU = nC_V ΔT.
Work done by the gas can be calculated using W = P ΔV.
In an isochoric process (constant volume), no work is done: W_AB = 0.
Process BC is isobaric with P = 1 × 10^5 Pa, V_B = 1 × 10^-3 m^3, V_C = 3 × 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate work done from B to C: W_BC = 1 × 10^5 Pa × (3 × 10^-3 m^3 - 1 × 10^-3 m^3) = 200 J.
Total heat transferred is the heat added in the isobaric process: Q = W_BC = 200 J.
The amount of heat transferred by the gas is 200 J.
